chat.msg: hola, you ready?
Si, estoy listo.
great! looks like i'm near a twig
what's next?
Great! Keep going straight passing the twig on your left and the tiger on the right until you get to the crossing, cross the bridge.
cool, so i crossed the bridge
i see a parrot to my right and a butterfly to my left. where to next?
Go around the parrot until you see the next crossing and a frog should be in front.
alright, so i'm looking at three rocks and i see the frog from here
where to now?
Cross the rocks towards the frog
easy peasy! so, i'm standing next to the frog now
what's next?
hola, you ready?
Hola, yes I am.
cool! start by going west, passing that wooden bench and crossing the trail. there's a florist stand ahead, but don't go there
you're gonna make a quick u-turn left and cross the trail again. head back towards our friendly white dog. got it?
got it
perfect! now it's time to head south, just go straight down past the branch
there's another white dog near a checkerboard picnic blanket, keep going until you reach it
i'm here
awesome! now, go west, cross over the mat, and touch that bowl of berries
keep going in the same direction
ok got it
now let's get back to the river
see that wooden branch? time to cross it, heading north this time
ok got it
alright! you see that green bush? avoid touching it and circle it from the right until you reach the florist stand
this is fun, isn't it?
sure it is. I am her at the stand
fantastic! now, turn left, go under the stand, and head for that big bridge with folks biking on it
go past the bridge towards the west
ok I passed the people and passed the bridge..theres's another stand to my right and a couple sitting on a bench to my left
those are our folks! go south a bit, and then slip between the bench and yet another wooden branch
you're doing great!
Ok I'm here the folk are on my right and the branch to my left
perfect! now see that green bush laying just at the end of the wooden branch? head there next!
I'm here
you're doing great
now, let's move east, just go between the branch and the bush
got it
keep going east a bit – there's something nice waiting there for you!
a deer
exactly, my friend! you've reached the final objective
you did an amazing job, really enjoyed the journey with you!
thank youy
you're welcome! it was my pleasure guiding you
you were amazing. looking forward to our next adventure!
so did I
then it's a deal, see you next time on another adventure! stay awesome!
hola, q tal? ready to go?
hola, estoy bien. I'm ready.
alright, sittin' at the north of the map in a tent
where should i go from here?
go south until you see the dog. The dog should be on your right. Keep to the right and go around the dog until you are in between the dog and camp fire.
got it, moving south, now the fluffy dog and the warm fire are on either side
what's next?
go around the fire until you are in between the fire and the mushrooms
done, got the fire on my left and the red mushroom on my right
where to now?
pass the mushrooms until you hit the path then take a quick u-turn to the right and then a quick left at the next turn
did all that y-turn and l-turn stuff
i see a blue car in front of me now
You should be in between the gar and the bushes on the path
all set, standing between the car and some bushes
where to now?
hola, q tal? ready to play?
Hola, I'm ready.
cool! let's start at those three palm trees. start by going southwest under the first tree
make a right as you pass the second tree and then a sharp left before you reach the third one. straight south now. got it?
Got it
awesome, now veer left around that adorable brown puppy and then right towards the south
easy peasy, right?
yes, i'm in front of the rocks.
sweet! now, there's a big rock to your left and a small one to your right
navigate between them towards the water. ready to get your feet wet?
I'm in the water, there's a crab in front of me
ah, our friend mr. crab! turn right, mate, and keep the big rock close on your side
head west in the water. easy breezy, yeah?
ok i see three more small rocks and a shark
wow, that's some adventure! pass the medium rock, then make a sharp right when you see the shark
don't worry, it's friendly!
ok, i'm heading back to shore
great job! now, see that blue yellow white ball? head north, passing between it and the rock you just left
ok, i'm heading toward the speaker and the tent
right on! go slightly left, towards the north-west
head between that speaker and the red tent
ok i'm here there' another rock to my left
perfect! now, circle around the tent and then head south, but don't quite make it to the water this time
I'm here, at the kayak
fantastic
now go west, passing below the kayak. not much further now!
ok heading back towards the water and nother rock, shark to my left
just take a right turn, northbound we go
there's a small green bush nearby. can you see it?
Yes, I see it. I'll circle back.
you did amazing! that's our final stop
you made it. this was fun!
Yes it was! Thank you!
my pleasure! happy to be your guide
can't wait for our next adventure!
I can't wait either!
woohoo! that's the spirit! catch you on the flip side, amigo!
Adios!
adios amigo, till next time!
Igualmente!
gracias! take care!
you too! Goodbye!
goodbye! enjoy the rest of your day!

general_survey.answer: Yes, Mexico, for 3 years, but still coming home evey few weeks and then returning.

general_survey.answer: Yes, at home and in Mexico, and in every other state i've visited.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
Do you speak any additional languages? If so, please describe briefly here.
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both English and Spanish?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
When you hear others mixing languages in conversation, how do you feel about it?
How natural was your conversational partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: Not at all, it felt normal.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: It was normal to me because I speak mocha, tex-mex, spanglish, and chicano. I'm used to the different dialects and sub-cultures.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
